department.dept_long_name: Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Elementary Bosnian/Croatian/Serbian
course.description: Individualized study of the Bosnian/Croatian/Serbian language at the elementary level, conducted as a tutorial. Contact hours with language coach. Emphasis on literacy.
course.notes: Not open to auditors. Course offered only by application and upon approval by the Director of the Language Program and the Office of Undergraduate Education. Students must demonstrate clear academic need for the tutorial (e.g. knowledge of the language contributes to thesis research, other coursework, planned study/research/internships abroad, etc.) Mere academic interest in the language is not sufficient for approval. Application information is available at the Slavic Department website. Interested students should submit on-line applications to staff assistant, Jolanta Davis, slavic@fas.harvard.edu, preferably by the second day of classes. No applications accepted after Friday of the first week of classes.
